title: Northvolt and Volvo Cars select Gothenburg for gigafactory
notes:
Location:
- The battery manufacturing plant is located in Torslanda, Gothenburg, Sweden.

Capacity:
- The plant will have a potential annual cell production capacity of up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh), which would supply batteries for approximately half a million cars per year.

Investment amounts:
- The investment for the plant is part of an approximately SEK 30 billion investment by Volvo Cars and Northvolt.

Project progress:
- Construction of the plant will start in 2023, and it is expected to commence operations in 2025.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with construction starting in 2023.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Subsidies:
- There is no specific mention of subsidies in the provided information.

Note: The information provided does not specify the exact amount of capital invested into the project or any subsidies received.

title: Volvo Cars & Northvolt to open Gothenburg battery R&D center
notes:
Location:
- The project is located in Gothenburg, Sweden, where Volvo Cars and Northvolt will open a joint research and development (R&D) center.

Capacity:
- The planned annual capacity of the joint battery plant is up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh), which would supply batteries for approximately half a million cars per year. Large-scale production is expected to start in 2026.

Investment amounts:
- Volvo Cars and Northvolt are part of a SEK 30 billion investment in battery development and manufacturing. The joint venture for the development and sustainable production of batteries for the next generation of pure electric Volvo cars has been announced.

Project progress:
- The R&D center is expected to become operational in 2022. The construction of a new manufacturing plant in Europe is planned to follow, with the exact location of the plant expected to be confirmed in early 2022. The plant will start construction in 2023, with large-scale production in 2026.

Project type:
- The project involves the establishment of a new manufacturing plant in Europe for the production of next-generation state-of-the-art battery cells.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the stages of cathode and anode manufacturing, cell fabrication, and module assembly.

Note: The articles did not provide specific details about the capital invested or any subsidies received for the project.

title: The battery factory in Gothenburg, get the full story
notes:
Location:
- The battery manufacturing plant is located in Gothenburg, Sweden, next to Volvo Cars' assembly plant in Torslanda.

Capacity:
- The facility is expected to be operational in 2025 and, once fully developed, will deliver batteries to half a million cars each year.

Investment amounts:
- Volvo Cars and Northvolt are investing SEK 30 billion in the joint venture for the new facility.

Project progress:
- The first activity for the new jointly owned company is a battery research and development center, which is currently operational. The facility is expected to be fully operational by 2025.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, representing the first production facility for the joint venture between Volvo Cars and Northvolt.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.

title: Volvo and Northvolt start building battery cell factory in Gothenburg
notes:
Location:
- The battery production project is located in the Gothenburg district of Torslanda, Sweden.

Capacity:
- The factory has a potential annual capacity of up to 50 GWh.

Investment amounts:
- N/A

Project progress:
- The joint battery cell factory received building permission from the Swedish Land and Environment Court and building permits from the city planning committee in Gothenburg. The first production line is expected to be commissioned at the end of 2026. The stakeholders have met for a groundbreaking ceremony, and preparatory projects for cooling and power supply are already underway.

Project type:
- The project is a new build, with the first production line being constructed from scratch.

Value chain stages:
- The facility will cover the stages of cell fabrication and module assembly.

title: Volvo Cars and Northvolt to open Gothenburg R&D centre as part of SEK 30bn investment in battery development and manufacturing
notes:
Location:
- The project involves the establishment of a joint research and development (R&D) center in Gothenburg, Sweden, as well as the construction of a new manufacturing plant in Europe. The exact location of the manufacturing plant is expected to be confirmed in early 2022.

Capacity:
- The manufacturing plant is expected to have a potential annual capacity of up to 50 gigawatt hours (GWh), which would supply batteries for approximately half a million cars per year. Large-scale production is anticipated to commence in 2026.

Investment amounts:
- Volvo Cars and Northvolt are jointly investing SEK 30 billion in battery development and manufacturing. Additionally, Northvolt has secured in excess of $27 billion worth of contracts from key customers to support its plan, including Volvo Cars and Polestar.

Project progress:
- The R&D center is set to become operational in 2022, creating several hundred jobs in Gothenburg. The construction of the manufacturing plant is scheduled to commence in 2023, with large-scale production expected to begin in 2026.

Project type:
- The project involves the establishment of a new manufacturing plant in Europe for the production of next-generation state-of-the-art battery cells, specifically developed for use in next-generation pure electric Volvo and Polestar cars.

Value chain stages:
- The project covers the entire value chain stages, including the development and sustainable production of batteries, from research and development to large-scale production for electric vehicles.
